CassandraJoins

Class CassandraJoins

  • java.lang.Object
    • CassandraJoins.CassandraJoins

  • public class CassandraJoins
extends java.lang.Object
    Main Class for CassandraJoins Java API. Call first (once) CassandraJoins.connect() static method to get a new Cassandra Cluster connection (ClusterConn) Then you can call (multiple times) CassandraJoins.join(ClusterConn, ...) static method to join two Cassandra tables To close the connection call ClusterConn.close()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static com.datastax.driver.core.Cluster connect(java.lang.String node)
      Call CassandraJoins.connect() to get a new Cassandra Cluster connection
      static void join(com.datastax.driver.core.Cluster ClusterConn, java.lang.String KeySpace, java.lang.String tableName1, java.lang.String columnName1, java.lang.String[] selectColumns1, java.lang.String[] whereRelations1, java.lang.String tableName2, java.lang.String columnName2, java.lang.String[] selectColumns2, java.lang.String[] whereRelations2, long rowsLimit, java.lang.String resultTableName, java.lang.String operator)
      Joins two tables and creates a new table with the result columns

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public static com.datastax.driver.core.Cluster connect(java.lang.String node)
        Call CassandraJoins.connect() to get a new Cassandra Cluster connection
        Parameters:
        node - The IP address or the host name of the cassandra node to connect, eg: localhost
        Returns:
        A com.datastax.driver.core.Cluster object

      • join

        public static void join(com.datastax.driver.core.Cluster ClusterConn,
                        java.lang.String KeySpace,
                        java.lang.String tableName1,
                        java.lang.String columnName1,
                        java.lang.String[] selectColumns1,
                        java.lang.String[] whereRelations1,
                        java.lang.String tableName2,
                        java.lang.String columnName2,
                        java.lang.String[] selectColumns2,
                        java.lang.String[] whereRelations2,
                        long rowsLimit,
                        java.lang.String resultTableName,
                        java.lang.String operator)
                 throws CassandraJoinsException
        Joins two tables and creates a new table with the result columns
        Parameters:
        ClusterConn - Connection to Cassandra Cluster
        KeySpace - Cassandra Keyspace containing the tables for join
        tableName1 - Name of the first table to join
        columnName1 - Name of the column of the first table to be used for join
        selectColumns1 - Array containing the names of the columns of the first table we can to include on the join result
        whereRelations1 - Array containing all the CQL "where" clauses for the selections to be performed on the first table, each entry must has the format COLUMNNAME OP VALUE where COLUMNNAME is a column of the first table, OP is a valid operator in cql and VALUE is a value of a valid cql data type (including collection data types)
        tableName2 - Name of the second table to join
        columnName2 - Name of the column of the second table to be used for join
        selectColumns2 - Array containing the names of the columns of the second table we can to include on the join result
        whereRelations2 - Array cointaining where clauses for the selections to be performed on the second table
        rowsLimit - The number of rows we want to use from each table to perform the join
        resultTableName - The name of the new table to be created containing the result of JOIN operation
        operator - Must be "=" for traditional join or "CONTAINS" to perform joins where ColumnName2 data type is a set, map or list containing values matching ColumnName1
        Throws:
        CassandraJoinsException - If parameters are wrong, tables or columns doesn't exists or join can't be performed
